Там можно стрелять и ругаться матом на тиммейтов или оппонентов. 
Я люблю брать пулемет и сидеть в окне на респе оппонентов и слушать в г.чате как у них взрывается жопа.
Стрелять сложно но возможно если поставить пулемёт на сошки и стрелять из него то отдачи нету.
Много пулеметов брать нельзя поэтому не сидеть 10 пулемётчикам на миду.
Тут есть базука она взрывается не стреляйте себе в ноги вы умрёте.
Много а.серверов так что если у вас русский ник то готовьтесь к водке балалайке путину и медведю в шапке-ушанке.
Тут нельзя подолгу лежать(тут можно ложится на пузо!!!)со снайперкой на одном и томже месте то вас могут забанить на сервере.
Не убивайте тиммейтов это плохо!
Тут много карт не заскучаеш.
Неплохо вольво это стоющая игра берите не пожалеете(если только вы не криворукий школьник с оооооооооооочень плохой реакцией и постоянно спрашивающий ДА КАК ТАК ААААААААА).

                                                                         12/10

melhor do mundo

Well I have been a member of DoD since before steam was even created. I have been playing half-life mods for almost 20 years now. Mainly Day of Defeat, CS and TF with a few other mods in there that are no longer around. DOD is a great fast paced game and I have developed great skills at it. I do recommend this game to anyone who likes a fast paced FPS but it is because of these new people and even the people who can never progress there skills on this game that worries me. YOU CAN BE TO GOOD FOR THIS GAME NOW! This new community is killing this game for the skilled and next generation of skilled players to come. I hate that I will say i am sorry im to good for you, I am sorry you are not as good as me, I am sorry you will never be good and will continue to remain at the lvel of skill you are at. Don't blame and accuse the better of cheating, hacking, botting or whatever other term you would like to use just because they are better then you. It especially ticks me off when I get banned all for accusations of doing either of them. I wish this game worked like the law in a way, "innocent until proven guilty". For all my talented and skilled players of DOD hats off to you. The ones that don't hack, bot or cheat in anyways and always get accused of it. WE ARE JUST TO GOOD AND WILL BE PUNISHED BY ACCUSATIONS OF BEING TO GOOD TO BE TRUE!

Day of Defeat Source is a World War 2 multiplayer shooter by valve and is in the style of counter strike but will you want to play CS or this ? Day of Defeat is essiantly counter strike but set in the world war. You can choose two factions the US or the Germans and you fight it out to win. So how is this game ? This game is actually pretty fun but is no where near as fun as counter strike in my eyes but its still a very good game. Theres not much i can say cause this game is just like counter strike bu there are some diffrences. The maps are way bigger and the guns take some time getting used to. But there are a few negatives i want to talk about. Its quite difficult to find people who play on the official valve servers and not some neon filled maps (even though i kinda like those) but the biggest gripe with this game is the community. If you get on a map thats quite populated you will get kicked off for pretty much anything negative you do. Talking on the mic or playing badly will get you kicked off the server quickly. Overall Day of Defeat Source is  a really good game and without a doubt if you like MP shooters get this game right now. I give Day of Defeat Source an 8/10
Brother classic World War 2 FPS game
Geilstes game ever :D
Very nice and nostalgic

Of course, this one is a classic!  Enjoyed this immensely back when it first came out, and after a long hiatus, booted it back up and was immediately thrilled again!  The setting is nostalgic WWII and the enviroments are immersive and pretty.  I especially enjoy the  weapons in this game that offer a unique experience compared to modern shooters.   This is one of my timeless favorites!

A slightly boring game that feels like it didn't live up to it's potential. There's so little to do and so little to see that it feels unfinished. When I say unfinished I don't mean it's buggy I just mean it's generally lacking in content on it's own and missing features from the original. Some of the community still playing is pretty awesome though and or course it's cool to play a WW2 shooter on the Source engine that allows for ADS with some weapons and even CRAWLING. Sniping in Day of Deafeat Source is my personal favorite and some best fun you'll have in my opinion.

Unfortunatley player limits on how many players can choose a certain class make it so that you'll have to wait to get your chance. Every other gun feels like crap and controls as well as a wet turd on a treadmill which feels like it might have been an attempt at realism. I like this game oddly enough but just because I like something doesn't mean it's good. It's not overwhelmingly bad but it's hardly above average and only worth 5 dollars NOT 10. If you are curious buy it on a sale.

Ayant acheté le pack valve complet, j'ai pu donc tester ce jeu. Génial ! Bon pour résumer vous avez deux équipes : L'axe ( Allemands ) puis les Alliés ( Américains principalement ). Le but est de capturer le plus de drapeaux pour enfin gagner la partie, d'autres modes de jeu tels que le mode "démolition" si on peut le traduire, a pour but de faire exploser l'artillerie ennemie, monuments etc... Un mode comme CS en gros. Mais ce qui fait la force du jeu c'est son ambiance, car oui les classes d'armes, soldats, voix sont en rapport avec les soldats de la seconde guerre mondiale. Des cartes customisées sont aussi disponibles avec d'autres modes. Le seul regret que l'on puisse avoir est l'absence du workshop, ce qui aurait pu faciliter le travail des moddeurs. Une campagne aurait été bien aussi.

Excellent, simple first person shooter focusing on pure skill over gadgets and gizmos.  Out of all of the games I've played over the years, this one still remains at the top of my favorites list after being on the market for a full 10 years.  The online community is still very active, not just in the US but especially in Europe (Germany France UK) as well.  I almost never play the same level twice.  And unlike COD the conversations over teamspeak are almost always intellegent and funny.  Even if I don't feel like playing I put it on spectate just to hear people talk.  Best WWII shooter, best fps, best game ever made, highly recommended.
One of the best World War II FPS of all time.

One might guess that Valve's neglect of DOD: Source means it's a blight on their record they'd like forgotten, but in fact it's quite possibly to DOD:S's benefit that Valve has left the game untouched all these years. DOD: Source has a sense of focus and purity that you won't find in Team Fortress 2, or perhaps even CS. Zero cosmetics, zero DLC, zero bloat.

There's no gadgetry to be found, save for frag and smoke grenades. Weapons have satisfyingly strong recoil -- if you want to 'Rambo' with a MG-42, you're gonna need a massive mouse-pad. Movement is fast and overall results in somewhat frenetic gameplay. There's Arena Shooter genes here.

That said, this is a game that places notable emphasis on teamwork. Barring imbalanced teams, the side with better coordination is likely to win the match. Many points are challenging to capture/hold without teamwork, to say nothing about completing the Detonation objectives on Colmar and Jagd.

Graphics are simple (not bad for 2005) and easy to read. Sounds are satisfying and the DOD theme is wonderfully nostalgic.

The official Valve-made map rotation is slim, with just 9 total (Anzio, Argentan, Avalanche, Colmar, Donner, Flash, Jagd, Kalt, Palermo). The map design therein is strong however. There are also community-made maps available, many of which are quite good.

Player population for the Eastern US is rather decent. In prime time many servers are full and even in the more off-hours there's usually life to be found. It's a small but dedicated community, and far from a dead game.

I wholeheartedly suggest giving this game a try -- everyone should already own it since every Steam user should purchase the Valve Complete Pack in the first place. There's some minor balance annoyances to be found but on the whole it's a remarkably polished multiplayer FPS.

Additional Notes: 
- If this sounds appealing but you absolutely cannot endure early Source Engine graphics, there's Day of Infamy by New World Interactive, a standalone expansion for Insurgency. It's not entirely the same vibe but it's similar and has Valve's blessing as a spiritual follow-up.

- The simplicity does result in a lack of variety, so in my play sessions I'll usually just stick around for one full map rotation before heading off to something else. This is a game I keep installed at all times though.

Day of Defeat has a long history. I was playing Day of Defeat  myself when I was about 16 asa a mod. I played right through to the introduction of Source. I'm 31 now and haven't played in years until I picked it up again in a sale.

The beauty is, you go right back into it. You remember instantly how it works because it is so naturally designed, if the two words can be put together. Even the abundance of Orange maps on the servers these days show how good the base gameplay is outside of the World War II setting. It doesn't matter if the map is all orange, or if the server is all Avalanche, because the base game is still fantastic to play. 

Every role can play it's part. Teamwork is needed to hold certain positions but maverick behaviour can sometimes seal the deal and is often needed for the last flag. Mental strategy is involved, psychological warfare in a small shooter. Let's push left, when we actually want to go right. Tie everyone down in one direction, then storm up the middle. Sneak a wild card in near their spawn and tie them down trying to find him, meanwhile everyone capture the other flags. 

Every single match has a million dynamic things going on like this which change case by case based on the people involved, the atmosphere of the server, etc. The experience in all is a fantastic one and if you have never tried it, I can't recommend it enough.
